name: Croesus
bio: Croesus was the king of Lydia renowned for his wealth.

name: Bias
bio: One of the Seven Sages of Greece.

name: Solon
bio: Athenian statesman and philosopher; one of the Seven Sages of Greece.

name: Adrastos
bio: Son of Gordias (the King of Phrygia). Adrostos killed his brother, and was driven out of Phrygia.

name: Candaules
bio: King of Lydia who shows his wife to Gyges.

name: Gyges
bio: Conspires with Candaules' wife to slay Candaules, becoming King of Lydia.

name: Sandanis
bio: Thought to be a wise man from Lydia.

name: Cyrus
bio: Founder of the Achaemenid Empire.

name: Deïokes
bio: First King of Medes.

name: Astyages
bio: Last King of Media.

name: Dareios
bio: Persian King who invaded Greece.

name: Xerxes
bio: Son of Darius who led an invasion of Greece and attacks on the Greek navy.

name: Leonidas
bio: King of Sparta. Hero of the Battle of Thermopylae.

name: Cleomenes
bio: King of Sparta who organized Greek resistance against Persia.

name: Hippias
bio: Exiled tyrant of Athens; allied with Persia.

name: Peisistratos
bio: Son of Hippocrates. Tyrannical ruler of Athens.

name: Polycrates
bio: Tyrant of Samos.

name: Thrasybulos
bio: Tyrant of Miletus.

name: Histiaios
bio: Tyrant of Miletus.

name: Aristagoras
bio: Tyrant of Miletus and instigator of the Ionian revolt.

name: Amasis
bio: King (Pharaoh) of Egypt.

name: Psammetichos
bio: Pharaoh of Egypt when Cambyses II invades.

name: Nitocris
bio: Queen of Egypt.

name: Tomyris
bio: Queen of the Massagetae who defeated and killed Cyrus the Great.

name: Amyntas
bio: Sixth King of Macedonia.

name: Miltiades
bio: Athenian statesman and general at Marathon.

name: Themistocles
bio: Athenian politician, architect of the Greek naval strategy.

name: Eurybiades
bio: Spartan naval commander at Salamis.

name: Callimachos
bio: Athenian polemarch at the Battle of Marathon.

name: Leotychides
bio: Spartan king and commander at Mycale.

name: Megabazos
bio: Persian general who subdued Thrace.

name: Mardonios
bio: Persian general in the invasions of Greece; killed during the Battle of Plataea.

name: Artaphrenes
bio: Persian satrap of Sardis.

name: Otanes
bio: Persian noble who advocated for democracy and equality before the law.

name: Periander
bio: Tyrant of Corinth and one of the Seven Sages.

name: Arion
bio: Poet saved by a dolphin.

name: Hecataios
bio: Historian and geographer, contemporary of Herodotus.

name: Anacharsis
bio: Scythian sage and philosopher.

name: Gorgo
bio: Queen of Sparta. Wife of Leonidas and daughter of Cleomenes.

name: Artemisia
bio: Queen of Halicarnassus, naval commander for Xerxes.

name: Amestris
bio: Wife of Xerxes.

name: Pheretime
bio: Queen of Cyrene.

name: Io
bio: Priestess of Hera abducted by the Phoenicians.

name: Europa
bio: Princess abducted by Zeus.

name: Helen
bio: Central figure in the Trojan War.

name: Demaratos
bio: Exiled Spartan king, advisor to Xerxes.

name: Skyles
bio: Scythian king who adopted Greek customs.

name: Charilaos
bio: Early Spartan king.

name: Telines
bio: Priest who unified factions in Gela.

name: Pheidippides
bio: Legendary runner who sought Spartan aid before the Battle of Marathon.

name: Kimon
bio: Athenian general and statesman.

name: Artembares
bio: Persian noble who suggested relocating the empire.

name: Phaidyme
bio: Daughter of Otanes who helped expose the false Smerdis by checking if he had ears.

name: Gorgo
bio: Queen of Sparta, wife of Leonidas and daughter of Cleomenes. Known for her wisdom even as a child when she warned her father about Aristagoras's bribes.

name: Masistes
bio: Brother of Xerxes and Persian military commander, caught in a tragic conflict involving his wife and Xerxes's wife Amestris.

name: Coës
bio: Son of Erxander, advised Darius during his Scythian campaign about keeping the bridge over the Ister intact.

name: Megabates
bio: Persian admiral who commanded the fleet in the failed expedition against Naxos.

name: Alexander
bio: King of Macedon during the Persian invasion, known as 'The Philhellene'. Son of Amyntas I.

name: Artaÿctes
bio: Persian governor of Sestos who desecrated the shrine of Protesilaus and was later crucified by the Athenians.

name: Tigranes
bio: Son of Artabanos, a Persian commander who led forces in the invasion of Greece.
